issue.title: Segmentation changes based on order of tracks specified

content.raw:
Turns it out it is sufficient to simply rearrange the track ordering on the command line in order to change the results of a segmentation:

Here are the results from different track orders on simpleseg:

        train/params/input.master for various track orders
        *** 1234:
        0 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.326028867922
        1 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.248158942032
        2 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.171398947976
        3 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.284832199944
        4 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.297712717376
        5 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.222874251676
        6 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.271547968463
        7 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.325225407558
        8 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.322975504772
        9 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.293175494325
        10 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.325065333531
        11 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.305786710101
        12 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.249520885068
        13 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.167584829927
        14 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.212802056354
        15 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.264554100533


        *** 3241:
        0 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.326028867922
        1 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.248158942032
        2 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.171398947976
        3 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.284832199944
        4 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.297712717376
        5 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.222874251676
        6 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.271547968463
        7 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.325225407558
        8 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.322975504772
        9 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.293175494325
        10 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.325065333531
        11 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.305786710101
        12 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.249520885068
        13 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.167584829927
        14 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.212802056354
        15 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.264554100533
        
What clearly happens is that the random seeds are identical, but the training inputs are different due to the different ordering of tracks.
content.html:
Turns it out it is sufficient to simply rearrange the track ordering on the command line in order to change the results of a segmentation:

Here are the results from different track orders on simpleseg:

    train/params/input.master for various track orders
    *** 1234:
    0 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.326028867922
    1 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.248158942032
    2 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.171398947976
    3 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.284832199944
    4 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.297712717376
    5 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.222874251676
    6 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.271547968463
    7 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.325225407558
    8 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.322975504772
    9 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.293175494325
    10 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.325065333531
    11 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.305786710101
    12 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.249520885068
    13 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.167584829927
    14 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.212802056354
    15 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.264554100533


    *** 3241:
    0 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.326028867922
    1 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.248158942032
    2 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.171398947976
    3 mean_seg0_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.284832199944
    4 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.297712717376
    5 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.222874251676
    6 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.271547968463
    7 mean_seg1_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.325225407558
    8 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.322975504772
    9 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.293175494325
    10 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.325065333531
    11 mean_seg2_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.305786710101
    12 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack3 1 0.249520885068
    13 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack2 1 0.167584829927
    14 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack4 1 0.212802056354
    15 mean_seg3_subseg0_testtrack1 1 0.264554100533

What clearly happens is that the random seeds are identical, but the training inputs are different due to the different ordering of tracks.
